skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice â€“ a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Ghorros Warhoof is a gnarled, ancient Centigor who is forever fighting, rutting or getting drunk. His unnaturally long life has spanned many centuries and he has slaughtered his way through countless wars without succumbing to his injuries.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Drunken Bravado" for all Centigor units
	(replaces: "Rowdy")
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: It is a rare moon indeed that does not see Ghorros go to war.

It has been rumoured that Centigors are wont to march into battle in a state of inebriation, though this is difficult to prove since the creatures, regardless of their condition, never fail to be fearsome opponents.

skillTree.localised_description: Amongst the Warhoof's hordes come all manner of nameless beasts and halfbreeds, and regardless of their size, barbarism or ferocity, they all pay respect to the Father when he is nearby.

skillTree.localised_name: The Sire of a Thousand Young
skillTree.localised_description: None can deny that Ghorros has a very great number of Centigor sons and acolytes, all fanatically devoted to their gnarled but undeniably potent leader.

effects.description: Dread cost: -50% for increasing capacity of Centigor units

skillTree.localised_description: With a base howl, the beast radiates strength and power, a warning to his enemies that death is coming.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
The desire to wreak havoc is innate, brought about not by choice but by sheer force of being.
The Beastman's fury stretches back before most can remember - they pursue their hatred with single-minded zeal.
The stench of raw, rotten meat causes others to balk, but the warherd revels in the flesh and brawn.
A snorting, hulking mass of blood-matted, mud-encrusted, sanguine-soaked fur - the Beastman is a terror to all.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He who locks horns with this master of the warherd does so at his own peril.
The world of man will fall at the Beastlord's hand, with every glittering city reduced to rubble and despair.
Lordship to the mighty! Power to the strong! Obedience is earned through bloody victory!
Carved into this battered and dishevelled stone is the mark of violent rage and sanguine desire.
The Ruinous Powers grant many gifts to their obedient servants; mutant disfigurements of flesh and might.
The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.
The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.
For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.
Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

skillTree.localised_description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.
This unit can pass through trees.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: Ghorros Warhoof, the Sire of a Thousand Young, is a gnarled, ancient Centigor who is forever fighting, rutting or getting drunk. Ghorros's unnaturally long life has spanned many centuries and he has slaughtered his way through countless wars without succumbing to his injuries. Not a single minute of his impressive lifespan has been spent idle, for the Warhoof is possessed of an unholy vitality, a virile and boundless energy that is matched only by the depths of his carnal urges. Amongst the strongest of these is a lust for violence and battle. It is a rare moon indeed that does not see Ghorros go to war.

effects.description: Unit capacity: +2 for all Centigor units
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for all Centigor units

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

items.colour_text: In battle Ghorros wields a great spiked club, every bit as blunt and unsubtle as its owner. Though crude, the Mansmasher bears the blessings of dozens of Bray-Shamans, and it has been soaked in the blood of ancient dynasties.

Atop his scalp Ghorros wears the broken skull of Arsil, the Prince of Unicorns, who had an unfortunate encounter with Ghorros in a moonlit glade many centuries ago. It still harbours some of the protective magic of its former owner.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Fear when fighting against Wood Elves

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: It is commonly said that Ghorros Warhoof is the father of a thousand young, and yet that still does not do his exploits justice. A menagerie of twisted terrors that cover the Old World from one end to the other share his bloodline.

	(Lord's army)
